title.narrative: IR 1.8 REPONSE & SORTIE DES URGENCES EAH

description.narrative: Intermediate Results (IR) 1.8: Between 2013 and 2018, children and families in crisis receive Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) humanitarian response which is predictable, prompt, accountable, universal, non-discriminatory, coordinated, and facilitates crisis resolution., which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD SURVIVALPCR1: By end 2018, the proportion of children, newborns, families who benefit from high health impact quality interventions, including HIV Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission (PMTCT), nutrition, and water - sanitation - hygiene (WASH ) increases significantly and fairly, particularly in health sub-divisions and communities.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR 1.8: Between 2013 and 2018, children and families in crisis receive WASH humanitarian response which is predictable, prompt, accountable, universal, non-discriminatory, coordinated, and facilitates crisis resolution.

description.narrative: Since 2013, a total of 13,679,309 people benefited from emergency water, hygiene and sanitation assistance provided by UNICEF partners beyond RRMP. This included 2,862,345 conflict-affected people in Kasai, Ituri, North and South Kivu provinces, 10,514,434 people affected or threatened by cholera epidemics, 213,454 people affected by natural disasters (mainly floods in provinces along the Congo River) and 89,076 severely malnourished children in Tanganyika and Bandundu regions. In 2019, 1.2 million people benefited from WASH services in UNICEF-supported healthcare facilities, schools and communities. During this cycle, the average rate of achievement of annual HAC targets was 72%. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/02/2020

title.narrative: % of vulnerable people who have received, in a coordinated way, a tailored WASH package according to the number of people targeted.[% de personnes vulnrables ayant reu, de faon coordonne, un paquet EAH adapt aux besoins par accord au nombre de personnes cibles.]
